alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:33AM EDT until April 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, 5600 - cfs - Waterfront park areas near the M-69 bridge and low lying areas along the river in Crystal Falls become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 7.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 05/09/1979. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 145 AM CDT.
